document_content.title: Referral to General Medicine for Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jensen has been experiencing persistent fatigue and generalized malaise for the past three months. She has not responded to initial lifestyle modifications and basic laboratory investigations.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports ongoing tiredness, difficulty concentrating, and non-restorative sleep. There are no associated fevers, weight loss, or night sweats. She denies recent travel or known infectious exposures.

sections.heading: Medical History
sections.content: No significant chronic illnesses. No history of anemia, thyroid disease, or depression. Surgical history is unremarkable.

sections.heading: Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker, occasional alcohol use, works as a graphic designer. No recreational drug use.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vital signs stable. Physical examination unremarkable with no lymphadenopathy, organomegaly, or focal neurological deficits.

sections.heading: Investigations to Date
sections.content: CBC, basic metabolic panel, TSH, and iron studies within normal limits.

sections.heading: Reason for Specialist Input
sections.content: Further evaluation is requested to rule out less common causes of fatigue, including autoimmune and endocrine disorders.
